page.title: 08Employment-General
page.content: With the decline of the coal industry, the majority of working people living in the area commute to Swansea, Llanelli, Carmarthen, Ammanford and other larger centres of population to work. The work ranges from being employed in Local and National Government, in Professional Services, in Service Industries and in factories. In the area itself there are small private businesses which provide work; a Farmer's Co-op, two private bus companies, a small private coal mine, local shops and cafes and a coal depot. There are also many self-employed builders living in the area. Local and National Government also provide work for local people in 2 schools, a small N.H.S. Hospital, a Fire Station, an Ambulance Station and a Job Centre.
